public interface IPGPUtils

Interface for PGP Utils, contains common functions for PGP compatibility

Method Detail

saveRSAPublicKey

void saveRSAPublicKey(java.lang.String fullFileName,
                      RSAPublicKey publicKey,
                      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> publicKeyInformationMap,
                      RSAKeyPair issuerKeyPair,
                      java.lang.Boolean ascArmor)
                      throws CryptoUtilsException
Saves a RSA Public Key un PGP Public Key Format

Parameters:
fullFileName - File in which the key will be saved
publicKey - RSA Public Key to save
publicKeyInformationMap - Map filled out with the publicKey owner information to be certify using the Field key ( CertificateInformationKeys Supported Keys) and the field value
issuerKeyPair - issuerKeyPair used for certify the publicKey information (Issuer KeyPair)
ascArmor - If the output file will be saved using ASCII Armor
Throws:
CryptoUtilsException

loadRSAPublicKey

RSAPublicKey loadRSAPublicKey(java.lang.String fullFileName)
                              throws CryptoUtilsException
Load a RSAPublicKey from a file containing a PGPPublicKey

Parameters:
fullFileName - File including its full path, in which the PGPPublicKey is located
Returns:
A valid RSAPublicKey
Throws:
CryptoUtilsException - if the file does not contain a valid PGPPublicKey

loadPublicKeyInformationMap

java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> loadPublicKeyInformationMap(java.lang.String fullFileName)
                                                                                 throws CryptoUtilsException
Load the public Key information from a PGPPublicKey file

Parameters:
fullFileName - File including its full path, in which the information is located in format of a PGPPublicKey
Returns:
A map containing the publicKey owner information, using the Field key ( CertificateInformationKeys Supported Keys) and the field value
Throws:
CryptoUtilsException - if the file does not contain a valid PGPPublicKey

saveRSAPrivateKey

void saveRSAPrivateKey(java.lang.String fullFileName,
                       RSAPrivateKey privateKey,
                       java.lang.String password,
                       java.lang.Boolean ascArmor)
                       throws CryptoUtilsException
Saves a RSAPrivateKey in PGP Format

Parameters:
fullFileName - File name (full path)
privateKey - RSAPrivateKey to be saved
password - Password for the file
ascArmor - If ASCII Armor should be used to encode the file
Throws:
CryptoUtilsException

loadRSAPrivateKey

RSAPrivateKey loadRSAPrivateKey(java.lang.String fullFileName,
                                java.lang.String password)
                                throws CryptoUtilsException
Load a RSAPrivateKey from a file in PGPSecretKey format

Parameters:
fullFileName - Full path and name of the file containing the PGPSecretKey
password - Password used for open the file
Returns:
a Valid RSAPrivateKey
Throws:
CryptoUtilsException - if the file does not contain a valid PGPSecretKey

saveRSAKeyPair

void saveRSAKeyPair(java.lang.String fullRSAPublicKeyFileName,
                    java.lang.String fullRSAPrivateKeyFileName,
                    RSAKeyPair keyPair,
                    java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> publicKeyInformationMap,
                    RSAKeyPair issuerKeyPair,
                    java.lang.String password,
                    java.lang.Boolean ascArmor)
                    throws CryptoUtilsException
Save a RSAKeyPair in two separate files, in PGP format

Parameters:
fullRSAPublicKeyFileName - File in which will be saved the RSAPublicKey
fullRSAPrivateKeyFileName - File in which will be saved the RSAPrivateKey
keyPair - KeyPair to be saved
publicKeyInformationMap - Map filled out with the publicKey owner information to be certify using the Field key ( CertificateInformationKeys Supported Keys) and the field value
issuerKeyPair - issuerKeyPair used for certify the publicKey information (Issuer KeyPair)
password - Password used for the PGPSecretKey
ascArmor - If ASCII Armor should be used or not
Throws:
CryptoUtilsException
